title: Conservation of momentum - mass of carts doubled

content.question: Two carts move in opposite directions, as shown, and collide simultaneously with a block that is at rest. The three objects stick together and do not move. Friction between the objects and the surface is negligible. The masses of the carts are then doubled, and the process is repeated with the carts having the same speeds as in the original scenario. How must the mass of the block change, if at all, so that after the three objects collide and stick together, they again do not move?

choices.label: It must decrease by a factor of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
It must increase by a factor of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
It must increase by a factor of <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math>.
The three objects will not move for any value of block mass.

content.answer: The three objects will not move for any value of block mass.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
